Name: TED Talks Corpus (WIT3)
Description: The TED Talks corpus contains transcribed and translated TED Talks from 82+ languages. It is curated for use in machine translation and natural language processing research, providing a valuable multilingual parallel corpus.
Paper Title: WIT3: Web Inventory of Transcribed and Translated Talks
Tasks: machine translation, speech recognition, language modeling, text generation
Authors: Mauro Cettolo, Christian Girardi, Marcello Federico
Affiliations: FBK – Fondazione Bruno Kessler, Trento, Italy
Abstract: WIT3 is a web-based inventory that provides access to the TED Talks corpus. It includes transcribed and translated talks in over 80 languages, making it a valuable resource for machine translation research. The corpus has been processed to be more convenient for researchers, providing benchmarks and tools for handling multilingual parallel texts.
